bibl.title: Letter from Albert E. Truby to Philip Showalter Hench, October 3, 1940

div1.p: Truby will send Hench his manuscript and asks for Cooke's address so he may send him a copy. He comments on and sketches the Camp [Columbia?] model, noting inaccuracies.

div1.head: Letter from Albert E. Truby to Philip Showalter Hench, October 3, 1940
div1.opener:
ALBERT E. TRUBY
145 LAUREL STREET
SAN FRANCISCO, CALIFORNIA
Oct- 3 '40
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
Your letter of the 1st has just reached
me and I hasten to answer as I
have had you on my mind, but
have been delayed by my trip and
an attack of the flu - Gen. Kean returned
my mms while I was away and I
am anxious for you to see it
before you start for the East. The
typing and spelling is terrible, but was
done by an inexperienced young girl.

I am also sending you copies of some correspondence
I have had with General Kean which will
give you some of the background of
the unfortunate situation, especially re.
Agramonte. When you have time we
can discuss it more fully-

I note that you have located Dr. Cooke.
I would like very much to have his
address. When you get through with my
mass. I want to let him read it and
tell me anything he finds at variance
with his ideas. I was very fond of Cooke.

He should know all about Agramonte
and what he did (if anything) at Camp Lazear.

Re. the model I think I understand
it. North of the ward buildings there was
a wide ravine running East & West and
leading up from the La Playa-Quemados road
to the main part of the Post. The model was
probably made in 1906 while our troops
were there for the second time. I was there then
for a short time and think that a rail-road
spur was operatingconcluded up that ravine to
to the Post. That would explain the tracks in
the model, but it was not to the West Side
of the hospital grounds and therefore not
the tracks separating the hospital grounds
from our ff. words.

No. This is wrong
P S Hench

The buildings in the
Photo of the model are
crowded together and
not according to scale. I
wonder if they were movable
and could have been
misplaced in assembling
the model? If so that
would explain a lot.
As photographed is
is absolutely inaccurate

I hope you have been able to locate
Mrs Lazear. It would be fine to have her
present at the Memorial Ceremonies.
